intro: Crotalaria macrocarpa subsp. matopoensis, commonly known as the Matopo crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemes, which are followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
